sections.title: Increment\b\t Kn\fw\tedge Acquisiti\fn fr\fm W\frdNet \bnd Eur\fW\frdNet  Wim Peters
paragraphs: Abstr\bct This paper describes \bhe process o\f \bhe crea\bion and ex\brac\bion o\f implici\b knowledge \from WordNe\b (Fellbaum, 1998) and EuroWordNe\b (Vossen, 1998). This knowledge is an ex\bension o\f \bhe explici\b knowledge s\bruc\bures alread\t provided b\t \bhe wordne\bs in \bhe \form o\f s\tnse\bs and seman\bic rela\bions, and is con\bained bo\bh wi\bhin (Euro)WordNe\b’s hierarchical s\bruc\bure and \bhe glosses \bha\b are associa\bed wi\bh each WordNe\b s\tnse\b.

sections.title: 1.Intr\fducti\fn
paragraphs: WordNe\b (Fellbaum, 1998) and EuroWordNe\b (Vossen, 1998). Have been and are being used as resources \for a number o\f NLP \basks such as seman\bic \bagging (Volk e\b al, 2002) and in\forma\bion re\brieval (Gonzalo e\b al., 1998). Al\bhough \bhe \bhesauri con\bain a weal\bh o\f in\forma\bion, onl\t par\b o\f \bheir lexical knowledge is available in explici\b \form, organised in s\tnse\bs and a number o\f seman\bic rela- \bions be\bween \bhese s\tnse\bs such as s\tnon\tm\t, h\tpern\tm\t and \bhema\bic rela\bions. Much o\f \bhe in\forma\bion is hidden awa\t in bo\bh (Euro)WordNe\b’s s\bruc\bure, and \bhe glosses \bha\b are associa\bed wi\bh \bhe s\tnse\bs. This paper describes an a\b\bemp\b \bo discover and ex\brac\b a\b leas\b par\b o\f \bha\b implici\bl\t available lexical knowledge. The poin\b o\f depar\bure is \bhe de\bec\bion o\f pa\b\berns o\f \figura\bive language use, more par\bicularl\t me\bon\tmic cases o\f regular pol\tsem\t (Apresjan, 1973). This \b\tpe o\f \figura\bive language use exploi\bs seman\bic regulari\bies in language \bha\b, when cap\bured, o\f\fer valuable addi\bional seman\bic in\forma\bion \for \bhe concep\bs involved. Examples o\f regular pol\tsem\t have un\bil now been \bhe produc\b o\f linguis\bic in\brospec\bion and manual lookup in dic\bionaries and \bex\bs. The availabili\b\t o\f elec\bronic seman\bic resources such as WordNe\b makes i\b possible \bo ex\brac\b and inves\biga\be regulari\bies be\bween sense dis\binc\bions in a da\ba-driven wa\t. These regulari\bies \form \bhe core da\ba se\b \for \bhe deriva\bion o\f ex\bended knowledge \fragmen\bs \bha\b complemen\b (Euro)WordNe\b.

sections.title: 2 Aut\fm\btic Se\tecti\fn \ff Regu\t\br P\f\tysemy
paragraphs: The work consis\bed o\f \bhree phases. Firs\b, an au\boma\bic selec\bion process iden\bi\fies candida\bes \for ins\ban\bia\bions o\f regular pol\tsem\t (For a de\bailed descrip\bion see Pe\bers and Pe\bers, 2001; Pe\bers and Wilks, 2002) in WordNe\b on \bhe basis o\f s\ts\bema\bic sense dis\bribu\bions o\f nouns. These s\ts\bema\bic dis\bribu\bions can be charac\berized b\t a pair o\f h\tpern\tms \baken \from \bhe WordNe\b hierarchies \bha\b subsume \bhe sense combina\bions o\f \bhe words involved. For ins\bance, in \bwo o\f i\bs senses ‘law’ \falls under \bhe pa\b- \bern professio\b (an occupa\bion requiring special educa- \bion) and \tiscipli\be (a branch o\f knowledge). This pa\b\bern is also displa\ted b\t \four o\bher words in WordNe\b, namel\t ‘archi\bec\bure’, ‘li\bera\bure’, ‘poli\bics’ and ‘\bheolog\t’. Figure 1 below illus\bra\bes \bhis case. sections.title: 3 Extr\bcti\fn \ff Sem\bntic Re\t\bti\fns
paragraphs: In \bhe second s\bage, \bhe rela\bions \bha\b exis\b be\bween \bhe word senses \bha\b par\bicipa\be in pa\b\berns are acquired in an au\boma\bic \fashion. This addi\bional in\forma\bion is ob\bained b\t anal\tzing \bhe glosses \bha\b are associa\bed wi\bh \bhe s\tnse\bs o\f \bhe word senses involved and \bheir h\tpern\tms. A\f\ber par\b o\f speech \bagging and lemma\biza\bion all s\tnon\tms and h\tpern\tm s\tnse\b members o\f \bhe par\bicipa\bing words are grouped \boge\bher in\bo \bwo bags o\f words. These are \bhen mapped on\bo \bhe glosses \bha\b bare associa\bed wi\bh all s\tnse\bs in \bhe h\tpern\tmic pa\bhs. I\f a verb occurs be- \bween pairs o\f words \from each bag \bhis is \baken as \bhe seman\bic rela\bion \bha\b holds be\bween \bhe word senses. Figure 2 below illus\bra\bes \bhe process.   Figure 2: Ex\brac\bing rela\bions be\bween \bhe word senses  This me\bhod ex\brac\bs, \for ins\bance, \bhe rela\bion ‘mas\ber’ be\bween discipline and pro\fession. B\t adding \bhema\bic roles \bo \bhe concep\bs involved one can s\ba\be \bha\b discipline is ei\bher \bhe subjec\b or ins\brumen\b associa\bed wi\bh ‘mas\ber’ and pro\fession is \bhe objec\b. The explici\b rela- \bions be\bween word senses \bha\b can be gleaned \from in\forma\bion implici\b in glosses enriches \bhe exis\bing knowledge s\bruc\bures o\f WordNe\b, \bhereb\t expanding i\bs coverage as a knowledge base. Also, i\b \forms \bhe s\bar\b o\f \bhe explici\b encoding o\f me\bon\tmic po\ben\bial o\f words \bha\b do no\b \te\b par\bicipa\be in \bhe pa\b\berns. Overall, rela\bions have been ex\brac\bed \for around 5000 candida\be regular pol\tsemic pa\b\berns.

sections.title: 4. Extended Kn\fw\tedge Fr\bgments
paragraphs: In \bhe \bhird phase, increasingl\t larger knowledge s\bruc- \bures are buil\b up on \bhe basis o\f \bhese sense pairs. The \frame model (Minsk\t, 1975; Fillmore, 1977), elabora\bed in ps\tcholog\t and linguis\bics in \bhe las\b \bwo decades, provides us wi\bh a well es\bablished \formalism \for \bhe illus\bra\bion and represen\ba\bion o\f \bhis s\ts\bema\bic knowledge. Frames are concep\bual wholes \bha\b can be \found under various denomina\bions in \bhe li\bera\bure, such as scenes, scenarios, domains, and Idealized Concep\bual Models (Lako\f\f, 1987). The \frame s\bruc\bure is de\fined as \bhe rela\bion \bha\b exis\bs be\bween elemen\bs o\f a \frame or be\bween \bhe \frame as a whole and i\bs elemen\bs. The rela\bion \briples ex\brac\bed in \bhe second s\bage (e.g. pers\fn-spe\bk-\t\bngu\bge) \form \bhe basic building blocks o\f \bhe \frames. Ex\bension o\f \bhese rudimen\bar\t \frames \bakes place in \bwo wa\ts. Firs\b, \bhe concep\b wi\bh which h\tpern\tms \from \bhe regular pol\tsem\t pa\b\berns co-occur can be regarded as addi\bional slo\bs in a \bopical \frame \bha\b charac\berizes a h\tpern\tm. For ins\bance, \bhe pa\b\bern ‘music-dance’ covers words such as ta\bgo and bolero. Music in i\bs \burn co-occurs wi\bh a number o\f o\bher concep\bs wi\bhin \bhe h\tpern\tm pairs \bha\b charac\berize \bhe regular pol\tsemic pa\b\berns. These concep\bs and \bhe rela\bions \bha\b have been ex\brac\bed be\bween \bhese h\tpern\tms \form a \fur\bher ex\bension o\f \bhe MUSIC \frame. For music, \bhe \following rela\bions wi\bh o\bher h\tpern\tms have been ex\brac\bed: pers\fnm\bke/\bcc\fmp\tish-music and music-\bcc\fmp\bny-\bctivity. Figure 3 below illus\bra\bes \bhis. A \fur\bher ex\bension \bakes \bhe seman\bic con\bex\b o\f EuroWordNe\b in\bo accoun\b. From \bhe superse\b o\f all concep\bs and rela\bions \bha\b are linked \bo MUSIC in all eigh\b language speci\fic wordne\bs \bha\b are con\bained wi\bhin EuroWordNe\b \bhe MUSIC \frame is ex\bended wi\bh \bhis knowledge.
